texts.label: text
texts.orig: There are multiple versions of this provision on screen. These apply to different geographical extents.
texts.text: There are multiple versions of this provision on screen. These apply to different geographical extents.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The term provision is used to describe a definable element in a piece of legislation that has legislative effect - such as a Part, Chapter or section.
texts.text: The term provision is used to describe a definable element in a piece of legislation that has legislative effect - such as a Part, Chapter or section.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Sometimes the text of a provision is changed, but the change(s) only apply to a particular geographical area. In some limited cases where this happens, the editorial team create a version for each different geographical area. Multiple versions are only created in this way where the change in question is a substitution so that there are different versions of the text for the different extents. Insertions and repeals of text do not give rise to such multiple versions.
texts.text: Sometimes the text of a provision is changed, but the change(s) only apply to a particular geographical area. In some limited cases where this happens, the editorial team create a version for each different geographical area. Multiple versions are only created in this way where the change in question is a substitution so that there are different versions of the text for the different extents. Insertions and repeals of text do not give rise to such multiple versions.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Building Regulations 2010, Section 38 is up to date with all changes known to be in force on or before 08 December 2025. There are changes that may be brought into force at a future date. Changes that have been made appear in the content and are referenced with annotations.
texts.text: The Building Regulations 2010, Section 38 is up to date with all changes known to be in force on or before 08 December 2025. There are changes that may be brought into force at a future date. Changes that have been made appear in the content and are referenced with annotations.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Revised legislation carried on this site may not be fully up to date. Changes and effects are recorded by our editorial team in lists which can be found in the 'Changes to Legislation' area. Where those effects have yet to be applied to the text of the legislation by the editorial team they are also listed alongside the legislation in the affected provisions. Use the 'more' link to open the changes and effects relevant to the provision you are viewing.
texts.text: Revised legislation carried on this site may not be fully up to date. Changes and effects are recorded by our editorial team in lists which can be found in the 'Changes to Legislation' area. Where those effects have yet to be applied to the text of the legislation by the editorial team they are also listed alongside the legislation in the affected provisions. Use the 'more' link to open the changes and effects relevant to the provision you are viewing.

texts.label: text

texts.text: This section has no associated Explanatory Memorandum

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 38. -(1) This regulation applies where building work-
texts.text: 38. -(1) This regulation applies where building work-

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (a) consists of or includes the erection or extension of a relevant building; or
texts.text: (a) consists of or includes the erection or extension of a relevant building; or

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (b) is carried out in connection with a relevant change of use of a building,
texts.text: (b) is carried out in connection with a relevant change of use of a building,

texts.label: text
texts.orig: and Part B of Schedule 1 imposes a requirement in relation to the work.
texts.text: and Part B of Schedule 1 imposes a requirement in relation to the work.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (2) The person carrying out the work must give fire safety information to the responsible person no later than-
texts.text: (2) The person carrying out the work must give fire safety information to the responsible person no later than-

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (a) where the building, proposed building or extension to which the building work relates is not occupied during the building work, the date of completion of the work or the date of occupation of the building or the extension, whichever is the earlier;
texts.text: (a) where the building, proposed building or extension to which the building work relates is not occupied during the building work, the date of completion of the work or the date of occupation of the building or the extension, whichever is the earlier;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (b) in any other case, the date of completion of the work.
texts.text: (b) in any other case, the date of completion of the work.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (2A) The responsible person must give the person carrying out the work a notice acknowledging receipt of the fire safety information and confirming the information provided is sufficient to enable them to understand, operate and maintain the building (and the fire safety systems in it) after the building work in question.
texts.text: (2A) The responsible person must give the person carrying out the work a notice acknowledging receipt of the fire safety information and confirming the information provided is sufficient to enable them to understand, operate and maintain the building (and the fire safety systems in it) after the building work in question.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (2B) Subject to paragraph (2D), the person carrying out the work must give a notice to the relevant authority-
texts.text: (2B) Subject to paragraph (2D), the person carrying out the work must give a notice to the relevant authority-

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (a) confirming that they have given the fire safety information to the responsible person pursuant to paragraph (2), and
texts.text: (a) confirming that they have given the fire safety information to the responsible person pursuant to paragraph (2), and

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (b) stating that they have received the notice from the responsible person pursuant to paragraph (2A) or where they have not received the notice, stating the steps taken to obtain the notice from the responsible person and the dates they were taken.
texts.text: (b) stating that they have received the notice from the responsible person pursuant to paragraph (2A) or where they have not received the notice, stating the steps taken to obtain the notice from the responsible person and the dates they were taken.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (2C) The notification under paragraph (2B) must be given no later than-
texts.text: (2C) The notification under paragraph (2B) must be given no later than-

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (a) where regulation 20 (provisions applicable to self-certification schemes) applies to the work, 30 days after the date referred to in paragraph (2),
texts.text: (a) where regulation 20 (provisions applicable to self-certification schemes) applies to the work, 30 days after the date referred to in paragraph (2),

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (b) in any other case, five days after the date referred to in paragraph (2).
texts.text: (b) in any other case, five days after the date referred to in paragraph (2).

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (2D) Paragraphs (2B) and (2C) do not apply where regulation 20A (provisions applicable to third party certification schemes) applies to the work and instead paragraphs (2E) to (2G) apply.
texts.text: (2D) Paragraphs (2B) and (2C) do not apply where regulation 20A (provisions applicable to third party certification schemes) applies to the work and instead paragraphs (2E) to (2G) apply.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (2E) Where this paragraph applies, the person carrying out the work must notify the third party certifier appointed under regulation 12(6)(c)-
texts.text: (2E) Where this paragraph applies, the person carrying out the work must notify the third party certifier appointed under regulation 12(6)(c)-

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (a) confirming that they have given the fire safety information to the responsible person pursuant to paragraph (2), and
texts.text: (a) confirming that they have given the fire safety information to the responsible person pursuant to paragraph (2), and

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (b) stating that they have received the notice from the responsible person pursuant to paragraph (2A) or where they have not received the notice, stating the steps taken to obtain the notice from the responsible person and the dates they were taken.
texts.text: (b) stating that they have received the notice from the responsible person pursuant to paragraph (2A) or where they have not received the notice, stating the steps taken to obtain the notice from the responsible person and the dates they were taken.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (2F) The notification under paragraph (2E) must be given no later than seven days after the date referred to in paragraph (2).
texts.text: (2F) The notification under paragraph (2E) must be given no later than seven days after the date referred to in paragraph (2).

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (2G) Within 30 days of receiving the notification under paragraph (2E) the third party certifier appointed under regulation 12(6)(c) must notify the relevant authority confirming receipt of the notification under paragraph (2E). ]
texts.text: (2G) Within 30 days of receiving the notification under paragraph (2E) the third party certifier appointed under regulation 12(6)(c) must notify the relevant authority confirming receipt of the notification under paragraph (2E). ]

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (a) " fire safety information " means information relating to the design and construction of the building or extension, and the services, fittings and equipment provided in or in connection with the building or extension which will assist the responsible person to operate and maintain the building or extension with reasonable safety;
texts.text: (a) " fire safety information " means information relating to the design and construction of the building or extension, and the services, fittings and equipment provided in or in connection with the building or extension which will assist the responsible person to operate and maintain the building or extension with reasonable safety;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (b) a "relevant building" is a building to which the Regulatory Reform (Fire Safety) Order 2005 applies, or will apply after the completion of building work;
texts.text: (b) a "relevant building" is a building to which the Regulatory Reform (Fire Safety) Order 2005 applies, or will apply after the completion of building work;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (c) a "relevant change of use" is a material change of use where, after the change of use takes place, the Regulatory Reform (Fire Safety) Order 2005 will apply, or continue to apply, to the building; and
texts.text: (c) a "relevant change of use" is a material change of use where, after the change of use takes place, the Regulatory Reform (Fire Safety) Order 2005 will apply, or continue to apply, to the building; and

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (d) " responsible person " has the meaning given by article 3 of the Regulatory Reform (Fire Safety) Order 2005.
texts.text: (d) " responsible person " has the meaning given by article 3 of the Regulatory Reform (Fire Safety) Order 2005.

texts.text: E1 This version of this provision applies to England only; a separate version has been created for Wales only

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (2) The person carrying out the work shall give fire safety information to the responsible person not later than the date of completion of the work, or the date of occupation of the building or extension, whichever is the earlier.
texts.text: (2) The person carrying out the work shall give fire safety information to the responsible person not later than the date of completion of the work, or the date of occupation of the building or extension, whichever is the earlier.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (a) " fire safety information " means information relating to the design and construction of the building or extension, and the services, fittings and equipment provided in or in connection with the building or extension which will assist the responsible person to operate and maintain the building or extension with reasonable safety;
texts.text: (a) " fire safety information " means information relating to the design and construction of the building or extension, and the services, fittings and equipment provided in or in connection with the building or extension which will assist the responsible person to operate and maintain the building or extension with reasonable safety;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (b) a "relevant building" is a building to which the Regulatory Reform (Fire Safety) Order 2005 applies, or will apply after the completion of building work;
texts.text: (b) a "relevant building" is a building to which the Regulatory Reform (Fire Safety) Order 2005 applies, or will apply after the completion of building work;

texts.orig: (c) a "relevant change of use" is a material change of use where, after the change of use takes place, the Regulatory Reform (Fire Safety) Order 2005 will apply, or continue to apply, to the building; and

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Explanatory Memorandum sets out a brief statement of the purpose of a Statutory Instrument and provides information about its policy objective and policy implications. They aim to make the Statutory Instrument accessible to readers who are not legally qualified and accompany any Statutory Instrument or Draft Statutory Instrument laid before Parliament from June 2004 onwards.
texts.text: Explanatory Memorandum sets out a brief statement of the purpose of a Statutory Instrument and provides information about its policy objective and policy implications. They aim to make the Statutory Instrument accessible to readers who are not legally qualified and accompany any Statutory Instrument or Draft Statutory Instrument laid before Parliament from June 2004 onwards.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Impact Assessments generally accompany all UK Government interventions of a regulatory nature that affect the private sector, civil society organisations and public services. They apply regardless of whether the regulation originates from a domestic or international source and can accompany primary (Acts etc) and secondary legislation (SIs). An Impact Assessment allows those with an interest in the policy area to understand:
texts.text: Impact Assessments generally accompany all UK Government interventions of a regulatory nature that affect the private sector, civil society organisations and public services. They apply regardless of whether the regulation originates from a domestic or international source and can accompany primary (Acts etc) and secondary legislation (SIs). An Impact Assessment allows those with an interest in the policy area to understand:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Why the government is proposing to intervene;
texts.text: Why the government is proposing to intervene;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The main options the government is considering, and which one is preferred;
texts.text: The main options the government is considering, and which one is preferred;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: How and to what extent new policies may impact on them; and,
texts.text: How and to what extent new policies may impact on them; and,

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The estimated costs and benefits of proposed measures.
texts.text: The estimated costs and benefits of proposed measures.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This timeline shows the different points in time where a change occurred. The dates will coincide with the earliest date on which the change (e.g an insertion, a repeal or a substitution) that was applied came into force. The first date in the timeline will usually be the earliest date when the provision came into force. In some cases the first date is 01/02/1991 (or for Northern Ireland legislation 01/01/2006). This date is our basedate. No versions before this date are available. For further information see the Editorial Practice Guide and Glossary under Help.
texts.text: This timeline shows the different points in time where a change occurred. The dates will coincide with the earliest date on which the change (e.g an insertion, a repeal or a substitution) that was applied came into force. The first date in the timeline will usually be the earliest date when the provision came into force. In some cases the first date is 01/02/1991 (or for Northern Ireland legislation 01/01/2006). This date is our basedate. No versions before this date are available. For further information see the Editorial Practice Guide and Glossary under Help.
